comments: The 13-digit cycle 1,0,1,2,6,5,8,2,2,7,8,4,8 in this sequence and the others based on seventy-ninths, gives the successive digits of the smallest integer which is multiplied by eight when the final digit is moved from the right hand end to the left hand end. - _Ian Duff_, Jan 09 2009
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
